reviews.title: Absolutely perfekt!!
reviews.review_text: The Product is so easy to use and there is so much in it it's definitely worth the price!! When I bought it I recommended it to all my friends and we use it every day!! Lovely product

reviews.title: Sensational colors & application
reviews.review_text: The colors I chose (Blueberry Pop & Donut) are gorgeous & they're applied so easily; however, I had no idea that they were waterproof as the data displayed onsite makes no mention of this fact so after washing my face, I still had to remove the liner with another product - slightly annoying. This information should be definitely described in the products' details.

reviews.title: More than a little disappointed
reviews.review_text: Really like the colors and array. BUT couldn't figure out how to extend the crayon. Until I started reading these reviews. Yes I will need to buy a NYX sharpener IF I decided to purchase more but when using a sharpener on plastic the life of that product is well? nil. So essentially one's cost is doubled even IF one purchased on sale. Won't buy any more.

reviews.title: Good stuff quite unfortunately packaged/designed
reviews.review_text: I like a soft chunky pencil, and was excited with the perfect eggplant color! Unfortunately, I assumed- because the pencil is clearly plastic, and the packaging is not clear at all that to GET AT the whole thing you HAVE TO SHARPEN OFF THE >PLASTIC< (whose not brilliant idea was that?)- that it would twist up. Like every other reviewer who mentions this feature, I find this design to be absolutely trash. Firstly because no one would expect this and the packaging does not clarify it, and secondly because even if you DO already own a sharpener that can manage it, you can never get the last bit out. While another reviewer gave a solution for extracting and potting the color, which is super resourceful, I actually wanted a soft-color pencil. With all the negative feedback and poor communication in the packaging, I really feel NYX should be sending people a refund or coupon for purchase price toward another product until they redesign this clear dud. On the upside, the product consistency is very versatile and the colors are great. Would welcome a "We want to make this right" action from the company! In the meantime will likely keep looking for this perfect color in another brand of twist-up pencil.

reviews.title: Beautiful colour.
reviews.review_text: It isn't a self winding pencil, so needs to be sharpened. In this day and age of too much plastic waste, that is ridiculous. It also arrived with the tip broken. Then I had to purchase a sharpener that would fit the pencil so it would be sharpened. I'd prefer to pay more so that it's self winding upwards! The 3 stars are for the colour and creaminess.

I got the color Sparkle Nude, and LOVED IT! It looked so great on my lower waterline and really made a whole look come together. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because the packaging was so terrible. The cap cracks so much and I had to throw it out after a couple weeks because I had nothing to keep it sealed! Love the product, but NEEDS better packaging!!!!

reviews.title: Sharpening is ridiculous!!!
reviews.review_text: I think I own just about every color and I use white on my eyes and another white on my lips. With all the colors I have I can't use them after I've worn them down. The plastic WILL NOT SHARPEN!!!! Please think about going back and looking into making it a regular fat pencil that can be sharpened or a roll up please. I don't think I will be buying anymore until something changes. ü§®‚òπÔ∏è

I like this pencil for the product. I have the color "Milk" and I love it as a highlight on my browbone and in the corners of my eyes. I am VERY fair and this pencil is so white I need to use a light hand. It's also very creamy which can be good and bad - the good being that it glides onto your skin, the not so good being that it's so creamy I wouldn't recommend wearing these on the eyelid without a primer underneath if you have oily lids because it's so soft and creamy that it does crease. Now the WORST thing: the packaging. I hate that there's plastic just under the actual product so that you can't sharpen the pencil! Some of these reviews are saying that there IS product in the shaft but why put it there unless you can get to it? NOT impressed with that at all. So, product, good. Packaging, bad.

reviews.title: Good product, terrible design. My hands hurt.
reviews.review_text: I'll admit. I love the product inside the pencil. It works well as an eyeshadow base. However, I've had this for a pretty decent amount of time but nearly never use it. Why? Because I don't have the grip strength of a Burmese python holding onto a particularly delicious rat. I don't have the power of a fully grown silverback gorilla. I cannot twist with the force and fury of a thousand supernovae. Which seems to be a requirement to use more than just the little nubbin atop the pencil itself. I know there's more product in there. I have been scouring the internet for two hours trying to find an easier way to get at the sweet goodness of Jumbo Eye Pencil. But try as I might, it eludes me. Sharpening this thing is like trying to extract Excalibur from the stone. One must have the royal lineage of Camelot to experience the privilege of applying this. Even with the advice to freeze it, to use the NYX brand dual sided sharpener, to turn it just so, and to sell my soul to the Devil himself... I can't sharpen this. The callouses I have on my hands from years of opening up soda bottles have been shredded by this seemingly innocuous eye pencil. I am sitting in tears, one eye half finished, as my mangled pencil sits in the freezer yet again in the hopes of making it accessible to me. No one else in my house has conquered the NYX Jumbo Eye Pencil, either. I know it is not just a moral failing on my part. In all seriousness, the design choice of using a smooth, semi-hard plastic instead of something like wood is, in my opinion, abysmal. I wasn't kidding about the callouses, or the fact that I am literally crying in frustration. Does anyone have any advice besides "You can use a sharpener!" because at this point I'm ready to painstakingly scrape it out and put it in a pot so I can apply it with a brush. I've learned that you can pry off the non-functional end of the pencil with pliers and push it out, so if the new sharpener I ordered doesn't work I'm gonna try that and give an update. As nice as this product is, really not worth the trouble of actually using it.

reviews.title: Jumbo Eye Pencil
reviews.review_text: This pencil is deceiving. I had to read the reviews to figure out how to get more product out of tube. It appears there are many complaints with the same issue. Why wouldn't your company make the pencil retractable? It would solve the confusion. I don't like a pencil that needs to be sharpened. won't buy this product again.

reviews.title: Product Nice - Packaging Awful
reviews.review_text: I did not know I had to buy a special sharpener for this product. Until I came on here. I have purchased two in Frosting because I liked the color. Only to find out I needed a special sharpener. I thought they would twist up. Bummer! I recommend the product because it's nice and creamy, however, skip it unless you get a special sharpener - which I did not know about and do not have. Won't buy again. :(

reviews.title: MY FAVORITE EYE PENCIL
reviews.review_text: I have used NYX eye pencils for years and love the choice of colors. After reading other reviews, it seems that people are confused about how to sharpen. These are NOT twist up pencils. They can be easily sharpened with a cosmetic sharpener which is only a few dollars.

reviews.title: DO NOT BUY‚Ä¶Waste of money and time-
reviews.review_text: Used once or twice. Nice color. Then the pencil became less pointy & shorter. Tried pliers to twist the bottom and Broke it! Then i got a chopstick and pushed it up from the bottom! It worked but the chopstick pushed through the stick. Here to try to figure out how to advance the pencil: can't be done ( must buy sharper).. As other reviewers have mentioned - a waste. Tomorrow i will try melting in the microwave. A really dump product. Won't buy again.

reviews.title: Great colours, horrible design
reviews.review_text: I love that NYX offers cruelty-free, vegan products. This jumbo pencil comes is great colours, it goes on and blends easily. I was excited to try this product, as I usually use Thrive, which is exponentially more expensive. After learning that the only way to get the product out is to sharpen the actual pencil, I have come to realize that the design is not worth saving money as it is so inconvenient. I hope that NYX will consider redesigning their eye pencils to twist for ease of use.

reviews.title: Can be sharpened!!
reviews.review_text: These jumbo sticks can be sharpened!! Use a sharpener with a dual sharpener. The large hole will work. I promise. I thought I had to throw mine away after about a week until I found a YouTube video showing that they can be sharpened. I was so excited!! Also, I am obsessed with the ‚Äúyogurt‚Äù shade.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.review_text: Brilliant color payoff and very easy to blend! Would recommend setting with a shadow as they never set fully, but still an inexpensive and reliable color base that I've fallen in love with. I wish people wouldn't leave low reviews because they didn't realize they needed to sharpen it, the pencil works fine and you receive a lot of product if you know how to properly sharpen it. I do wish that the discontinued colors would come back, I always loved this pencil because of its wide and colorful shade range, and seeing it slim down to just bare neutrals is a little disappointing. However that's just a personal note. I would definitely recommend these :-)

reviews.title: Jumbo eye pencil disapointing
reviews.review_text: The color goes on good. I actually looked up this product page bc I was like how in the heck can you get more product from it? Thank you everyone who commented about the plastic and needing the correct sharpener. It should twist up. I don't see myself buying a separate sharpener.

reviews.title: Skin Reaction
reviews.review_text: I tend not to have skin reactions to any new makeup product. This gave me the worst skin reaction of my life. It's been weeks and my eyelids are still peeling and bleeding. The most unique and awful experience I've had with makeup. would not recommend to anyone. Threw it away.

reviews.title: My favorite eye pencil!!
reviews.review_text: I bought this 2 weeks ago and I am the happiest girl alive! This pencil is absolutely amazing and makes your eyes pop like nothing you've seen before! I love it and get so obsessed that I end up using it on a daily basis. Just look at how It looks on my waterline.. I love it so much.

I own eleven of these and they are a staple in my kit. I wear them as liner and also as shadow. When I wear it as shadow I use an NYX primer. These jumbo pencils go on so smoothly and (with primer) don't crease, transfer, smudge or fade. There's some discussion on whether you can sharpen them but I don't have any problem sharpening them.I have very sensitive skin and eyes and it has become clear to me that NYX is all I can wear. So all the make up I own is NYX. That's all you'll find in my kit.

reviews.title: Directions would have been more than helpful.
reviews.review_text: I love the way the color glides over my eyelids but I too couldn't figure out how to get a new point. Directions on the packaging would have been more than helpful. I too was twisting, turning and pushing every way. Went to the website and found out that the crayon was to be sharpened. Three turns of the sharpener did the trick but then the point fell of -[ just like a real crayon. This problem ins too bad because I really like the product.

reviews.title: White for the Waterline
reviews.review_text: A staple of my make up collection, the milky white pencil was my first ever NYX purchase. I saw on a professional make up artist's website it was a "secret" of their's to use a white eyeliner for the waterline. Well I have purchase over a dozen different white eyeliners but NOTHING compares to the NYX Jumbo eye pencil. It is gentle on the delicate waterline of the eye, creamy but stays put too. I cannot count the number of times I come back to purchase another Milky white pencil because I use it EVERY DAY to complete my natural look. I have my sister, mother, aunt and best friend in on the act too!

reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.review_text: I love the color choices, but the fact that when the tiny tip is used up that's it. They say you can sharpen it but you can't. I was even given the suggestion to put the pencil in the freezer for a while then sharpen it, that didn't work either. I rather spend my money with another brand at least I can use all my monies worth. Shame on you NYX

reviews.title: Really bad transfer from upper water line to lower
reviews.review_text: I bought the black to smudge on my upper lash line to avoid the light skin showing underneath liner and falsies. It is very soft and goes on nicely to the skin, but it transfers really badly onto the lower lash line. Not just the lower water line, but even below where my lower lashes end. It makes a super messy look on the lower lash line. I've tried it twice, and both times I had to wipe off new smudges of black under my eye every time I went to the bathroom. Really disappointed, especially since I've seen beauty gurus use this exact product for this exact purpose.

reviews.title: Great White Pencil
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love NYX's Jumbo Eye Pencil in Milk. It is the best for highlighting the inner corner of the eye and wakes up even the most tired eyes with dark circles. It is such a simple trick, but it really makes a huge difference to your overall finished look. Will definitely be reordering! My only qualm is that I want to try the other shades but for some reason, Milk is the only shade that comes in plastic safety wrapping at the store. Not sure why this is but I would like to be assured that all NYX products are sealed so that I can be sure no one has used it as a tester and put it on their hand, eyes, or where ever else.

reviews.title: Easier to use if you depot them
reviews.review_text: Those are absolutely great! I use them as eyeshadows or to line my waterline ith a pop of colour and they don't move around at all. They also blend very well. Now, I know that a lot of people had trouble sharpening them, but I didn't even bother. They're actually creamy and soft enough that you can sorta depot them and squish them into a little jar or pot or something. I found a few tutorials on YouTube that shows you how to do it. It might be an extra step but it very easy to do and it's totally worth it.

I own almost all of these. The colors are great! The payoff is fantastic. However, they only get 3 stars because they CREASE so bad! Even with a primer. I have yet to meet one person who doesn't have creasing issues with this product. I usually apply it very thin to avoid creasing, but then I lose the color payoff. Your best bet is using a thin layer as a base for an eye shadow to improve the shadow's opacity. Hopefully, NYX will offer a water proof version of these (similar to the Maybelline color tattoos).

After 6 uses I went to sharpen it and it is not possible. The hard plastic won't be cut by a simple sharpener, and there is no way to twist it up like some pencils. I was so dumbfounded that I cut the shaft open with an exacto knife, and there IS product in the shaft, it is just unusable.

What have I been doing all of my life without Milk? It is the best make up product I've ever found. It is super long lasting, very pigmented, perfect for the waterline to open up your eyes - OR you can use it as a perfect base for eyeshadows to make them even brighter and more pigmented, and even makes them last longer. It is so creamy and spreads so evenly on the lid, NEVER creases (even without a primer) and I can't WAIT to get all the other colors! Basically, if I could marry Milk, I would.

reviews.title: Aging Eyes ‚ù§Ô∏è
reviews.review_text: I was kind of shocked by all of the negative comments. I have aging eyes so typically shadows, especially shimmers, settle into creases and move around after a few hours. I was pleasantly surprised that the shimmer wasn't overpowering, it blended well and stayed in place ALL day. I wish they came in matte colors, but that's really my only complaint.

reviews.title: Save your money
reviews.review_text: This has to be my biggest mistake yet. Pencil is so hard to work with. It doesn't roll up, what's on the tip is what you get. (Unless mine is not functioning properly). It smudges and creases. Not what I expected nor hoped for. A complete waste of money.

reviews.title: Love the eye cream but hate the container!
reviews.review_text: Only the tip of the eye pencil is accessible! Now I am supposed to buy a sharpener (almost for the same price) that will cut through the PLASTIC collar! How environmentally conscious it that! Until the company remedies this I will no longer buy any of their products.

reviews.title: Love the product
reviews.review_text: The product is great. Fun colors and easy to apply. But seriously the main complaint from most reviewers is how you get the product out when you've used it down. So why aren't you fixing that issue??!! (It can be sharpened but those directions are NOT TO BE FOUND ON THE PRODUCT) I'm sure most of us know it would cost a little more for a twist type pencil but I'm also sure most would pay the price for it.

reviews.title: Non twistable!
reviews.review_text: Was somewhat of an impulse buy, as I liked the color, however, i wish i would have passed and saved myself 5 bucks! Its kinda greasy, color transfers different from stick and it is NOT a twistable product. How the heckare you supposed to get more out? Surely there is more than the tip! Epic fail on product design.

reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
reviews.review_text: This is a great product. Application is easy and stays in place. I've been looking for an eye shadow jumbo crayon for a long time now. Thanks NYX. The Jumbo pencil is just what I wanted. The creamy texture does not ‚Äúsettle‚Äù and feels nice on the lid, not heavy. Great for older crepe-y eyes. Super blendable while staying put on the eye. Many great colors to choose. I don't understand so many negative reviews about having to sharpen the product. It says right there, jumbo PENCIL.

reviews.title: GREAT!
reviews.review_text: AHHH this is amazing. I've never tried anything like this before but it's wonderful. Normally when I put anything glittery on my face its tends to spread everywhere. I tried it on with just some concealer underneath and it stayed on a long time. It was a nice touch to my Greek look earlier today.

reviews.title: YOU CAN TOO SHARPEN IT
reviews.review_text: So at first I was very nervous about the fact that it doesn;t twist up or anything BUT I did some research (the internet is your friend, folks) and even tho it's plastic it still sharpens just fine. YAY. Love it (milk) as a base and i even used it as a highlight on the rest of my face then just put my regular powder over it. Love it so much. I promised my hubby I was done buying makup up for a while but as soon as i save up some money for my makeup fund I will deff try out some of the other colors.

reviews.title: Please never stop making these!
reviews.review_text: So I own quite a few of these, and I never bothered reading the reviews til now‚Ä¶I am hearing a lot about the lids breaking, quick fix. The reason the lids break is from pressing the cap down to hard when closing. I like to wrap a clear piece of scotch tape around the opening of the lid a few times, prior to using them, and just be careful not to close too hard. I haven't had one break since.

reviews.title: Like it but like all the others, disappointed.
reviews.review_text: I really like this pencil but the case is now torn up due to me trying to "twist" more out using pliers. Who would have thunk that you sharpen plastic. Some directions would have been nice before I tore up the case on it. All they have to do is write sharpen with sharpener on it!

reviews.title: Good, but difficult to open and worse to sharpen.
reviews.review_text: The colors you have for the Jumbo pencils are great, however, they do start to melt while you're still wearing it. Texas heat is pretty brutal and colors soften up too much then slowly slides right into my eyes. Not to mention the plastic outer part is making my sharpener really dull so that it is not sharpening my other pencils anymore, just chewing them up. Please go back to a twist up type for the pencil.

reviews.title: Epic Fail
reviews.review_text: It is not clear at all that you require a pencil sharpener to use this product. You assume it is a twist up pencil because it is plastic (not wood), but mostly because it gives the appearance of having a twist-up bottom. Having to buy the sharpener feels like it's just a bid for more money. So now I have to go back and buy an additional product when I just wanted to try out an inexpensive item. I also don't like the idea of sharpening plastic.

reviews.title: Love the shadow, but...
reviews.review_text: I really like the shadow, I have a difficult time finding a product that does not break me out and lasts all day. This shadow produces in that department. The packaging department however needs work. I had no idea how to retrieve more of the product from the tube and had to read the reviews before I realized you have to actually sharpen the plastic itself. This is ridiculous and needs to be improved.

reviews.title: Useless after tip is gone
reviews.review_text: I bought the Milk pencil. The color is nice and it is easy to apply. However, when I went o sharpen the pencil I realized that it is made out of heavy plastic. The pencil cannot be sharpened and it is not retractable! I read some other reviews on the pencil that said once they cut open the plastic there is product inside, but I have yet to do this. If I had known that the pencil cannot be sharpened I would not have bought it.

reviews.title: Great for an eyeshadow base
reviews.review_text: I purchased Jumbo Eye Pencils in Milk & Black Bean, normally I'm not a fan of chunky eye pencils but I had heard so much about these colours that I figured for the price: it was worth a try. They are very pigmented eye pencils, they glide on very nicely. I rarely wear them on their own because of the colours I chose being a little too intense but I found much use for them as an eyeshadow base. They make any colour on top of them POP!! I also used these for Halloween & fantasy makeup. My only real negative comment is that its really not obvious that these need to be SHARPENED, they are not a twist up and it took forever to figure it out -.-.

reviews.title: Zero pigment on lighter shades
reviews.review_text: I was really excited about trying these. I ordered a light pink and a taupe brown color. I switched them on my arm first and could only see a little color with the pink. Figured surely they must look better on the eyelids, right? Nope. The only way I could tell I had anything on was from the shine on my lids. I was surprised because I usually love Nix products but these don't live up to the brand. Maybe the bright colors like green or purple come out well but if you're looking for a lighter look, don't look here.

reviews.title: Please make it retractable or something
reviews.review_text: I love the product and the color and was so excited when I discovered it. However, I felt really stupid when I couldn't figure out how to make it advance as it got too low to use. I am relieved to read the other reviews of women who felt the same way I do. I can't afford to buy it to use only a few times, so will not purchase it again unless it is made to be retractable or at least have some way to advance it and have a plastic cap over it for protection.

reviews.title: Confused. How do you use the rest of the product?!
reviews.review_text: I really like the richness of the colors and how easy they are to apply, but, I don't understand how you use the rest of the shadow once the top is finished. You can't sharpen it because the container is plastic and it doesn't turn or anything. So does that mean you only get to use that little bit at the top? I'm totally confused because if that's the case, it doessn't seem worth the money to only get a small bit of product.

Absolutely LOVE!!!! I mainly use them as a base...they have wonderful color payoff, but they do tend to crease if used mainly as an eyeshadow. And if used as a base, you'll have to put a thin layer and unfortunately...the color payoff is lost. Applied thin...it's WONDERFUL. I have gold, cobalt, milk and rust with intentions to get more! So far my fave is cobalt, I love to put it on my waterline and lower lash line and then apply a matching shadow to the lower lash line...the color stays ALL DAY!!! I just wish they had a hot pink color, lol.

reviews.title: I love these but.. .
reviews.review_text: I buy these everytime I am at the store because they are simple to us and apply smoothly. But.... they need to redesign the tube and make it a twist up. The only way I can use it is to break off the bottom and add a hot glue stick to ensure I get it all. I had to YouTube it. No real way to sharpen.

I LOVE this product!!! It is so cute!! I got iced mocha which is like a taupe color and its extremely pretty! I also got strawberry milk and that is gorgeous! I also got cottage cheese which is not very pigmented in kinda just gives you a little bit of shine rather than milk which is very white. I also got sparkle nude which is like a skin color that is very shimmery and ahhhh i love it! I also got yogurt and it looks just like the picture it is gorgeous! I love them all and i probably sound crazy but I love them! them are cream eye shadows and they r so cheap!

The texture of Jumbo Eye Pencil is slightly sticky and blendable. It works well as a primer under eyeshadow, eyeliner, or eyeshadow. Apply it lightly for a wash of color with no creasing, blending with a finger. Pacific is a cool, faded denim color. Sort of periwinkle with a metallic finish. (The square display shows a rose color which needs to be fixed on the website, but the photo of the pencil is correct). Milk is a cream white and great for enhancing eyeshadow color. Sparkle Nude is a dark champagne color, metallic finish.
